dmca.title: [ABUSE] Court ruling confirms Internet Service Providers must act to stop web piracy.
dmca.body:
To Whom It May Concern:

Please note that below-referenced copyright infringement notice does not
substantially comply with the required notification elements of the Digital
Millennium Copyright Act of 1998 ("DMCA").

Please note that we have not passed on the substantive merits of your claim.

Please visit our web site at www.theplanet.com/legal.
 
Legal Response Team
THEPLANET.COM INTERNET SERVICES, INC.

-----Original Message-----
From: Policy Enforcement [mailto:abuse@theplanet.com] 
Sent: Tuesday, March 07, 2006 7:59 AM
To: copyright@theplanet.com
Subject: Fwd: [ABUSE] Court ruling confirms Internet Service Providers must
act to stop web piracy.

This message was received at abuse@theplanet.com on Tuesday, March 07, 2006
at
05:57:24 and concerns a matter for which responsibility is delegated to your
team. The message and headers follow.

Thank you,

Policy Enforcement
The Planet Internet Services, Inc.
http://www.theplanet.com/legal/

SUBJECT:
[ABUSE] Court ruling confirms Internet Service Providers must act to stop
web piracy.

MESSAGE BODY:
BlankTo, 

Pathos, Peter.    (www.jaanfm.com)
ThePlanet.com Internet Services, Inc.
1333 North Stemmons Freeway
Suite 110
Dallas
TX
75207
United States


Please find attached an news item that has appeared on the ifpi -
International Federation of the Phonographic Industry website regarding role
of ISP's in controlling piracy. 

In India too internet piracy is rampant & so we soliciate your co-operation
where ever required  in countering this menace.


Prem Kumar
Head
Internet Anti Piracy Unit
The Indian Music Industry
